meanings.definition: To change the shape or appearance of something in a negative way.
meanings.sent1: The heavy weight was deforming the soft clay.
meanings.sent2: The extreme heat was deforming the plastic container.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept deforming the playdough into strange shapes.
meanings.sent4: The relentless pressure of time was deforming her memories.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved swiftly, deforming the metal into a beautiful sculpture.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the old book cover started deforming.
meanings.sent2: The toy deformed after being left in the sun for too long.
meanings.sent3: The balloon slowly started deforming, much to the children's amusement.
meanings.sent4: His mind deformed the truth, creating a distorted version of events.
meanings.sent5: The once perfect circle deformed into an irregular shape.

meanings.definition: Causing something to become misshapen or distorted.
meanings.sent1: The deforming force of the strong winds bent the tree branches.
meanings.sent2: The deforming effect of the heat made the wax sculpture droop.
meanings.sent3: The deforming mirror at the carnival made everyone look funny.
meanings.sent4: The deforming power of the magnifying glass made the text appear warped.
meanings.sent5: The deforming pressure of the heavy object left a permanent mark on the table.
